triplets: Electronic device designed to perform arithmetic operations, ranging from basic calculations to advanced scientific and financial functions
Performing arithmetic calculations, solving mathematical problems, scientific computations, financial analysis, and educational purposes
Plastic casing, metal components, electronic circuits, LCD or LED display, rubber or plastic keys
Display screen for showing numbers and results
Keypad or buttons for inputting numbers and operations
Battery compartment or solar panel for power
Commonly black, silver, gray, or colorful depending on brand and design
Educational tools, office equipment, and personal electronics
Various electronics manufacturers including Casio, Texas Instruments, Sharp, and others
Typically 50–300 grams depending on size and type
Typically 1–3 cm; overall dimensions vary with model
5–15 years depending on build quality, usage, and battery maintenance
